intro: Janusia caudata, commonly known as the slender bracted bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in late summer. Janusia caudata is notable for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
